result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler C. Lemma

INCLUDES 22CM588 AND 22FO77. 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se.

Deft states he went to public defender and did not qualify for their representation.

COURT gives deft waiver of right to counsel form to complete. 
Deft demands speedy trial. 
Hearing on Waiver of Right to Counsel set for 9/9/2022 at 9:00 am.

letter from victim dated 8/31/22.
Final pre-trial on September 7, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Marathon County Victim Waiver of No Contact Bond Condition- W.L.

No contact with victim(s): W.S.L.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Defendant shall not possess or use any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:27 pm.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears, pro se.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

COURT QUASHES WARRANTS. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY. 

COURT ORDERS: $650 cash bond (posted) - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): W.S.L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.  
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of controlled substances, except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- No possession or use of dangerous weapons.
